hackathon-description-text: Spark new health tech innovations in a fun and competitive environment with 150 fellow developers, designers, and medical experts at the 24 hour MedHack MedHackathon.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Managing Director – Startup Lab, Singularity University
Associate Dean, University of San Francisco
Product Owner & HIT Strategy, BlueShield of CA
VP Quality and Care System Transformation, BlueShield of CA
Executive Director, Digital Health Development IS, Amgen
Sr. Manager, Global Benefits, Tesla Motors
Assistant Professor, UCSF School of Medicine
Vice President, Clinical, Regulatory & Quality, Tria Beauty

hackathon-eligibility:
Participants:
Location:
This is an in-person event, only in-person submissions are permitted.
hackathon-requirements:
Judging categories:
What to create:
Platforms
hackathon-rules:
All intellectual property produced at the event remains with those who created it. Prebacked, Inc. takes no responsibility in the protection, distribution, or ownership of intellectual property, code, ideas, nor concepts.
Your code, ideas, concepts, and intellectual property are yours alone.
Further rules will be posted closer to the event.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded for the solution that needs to exist, right now. Winning submissions fulfill a burning need.
Awarded for most impressive use of technology. It might not be scalable, but it sure is cool.
Awarded for most scalable product with a large market, incredible team, and glorious vision.
Awarded to the best integration of Validic. Prize includes several months of free workspace at the Validic office.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
How strong is the team's abilities?

1 = Fully unimpressed with every team member
5 = "I'd fund / hire every single person right this second."

Applies to:
Best hack
Most fundable

How large is the market for this product?

1 = No market
5 = $100BN market+

Applies to:
Most fundable
Most practical

"What, this, I can't believe... WOW"

1 = Yawn
5 = I can't breathe this is so cool

Applies to:
Best hack

How likely is this to save lives if the product worked, was developed, and widely distributed?

1 = won't save any lives
5 = Equivalent impact to curing AIDS, Cancer, etc.

Applies to:
Most practical

How strong is the team's vision for this product / prototype?

1 = No vision, likely a "best hack" category contender
5 = Fully developed path to market and beyond

Applies to:
Most fundable

hackathon-description-header: Health hackathon for developers and medical experts to spark innovations in health tech.
